ArticleTitle.sentence: Extensive overproduction of the AdhE protein by rng mutations depends on mutations in the cra gene or in the Cra-box of the adhE promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: Escherichia coli RNase G encoded by the rng gene is involved in degradation of adhE mRNA.

AbstractText.sentence: Overproduction of the AdhE protein by rng mutants was found to depend on the genetic background of strains derived from DC272 (adhC81) or MC1061.

AbstractText.sentence: We found that DC272 carried a point mutation in the Cra-binding site of the adhE promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: The Cra protein encoded by the cra gene is known to act as a repressor of adhE.

AbstractText.sentence: P1-phage-mediated transduction and lacZ fusion analysis with the mutant adhE promoter confirmed that this mutation is responsible for overproduction.
On the other hand, Southern hybridization revealed that MC1061 had a 0.85-kb deletion of the cra gene.
Overproduction of AdhE in the MC1061 background was reversed to the wild-type levels by introduction of a plasmid carrying the cra(+) gene.

AbstractText.sentence: These results indicated that expression of the adhE gene was regulated transcriptionally by Cra and posttranscriptionally by RNase G.
